00023 #ifndef __LIBCFS_LIST_H__
00024 #define __LIBCFS_LIST_H__
00025 
00026 #ifdef __KERNEL__
00027 # include <linux/list.h>
00028 #else /* __KERNEL__ */
00029 
00030 /*
00031  * Simple doubly linked list implementation.
00032  *
00033  * Some of the internal functions ("__xxx") are useful when
00034  * manipulating whole lists rather than single entries, as
00035  * sometimes we already know the next/prev entries and we can
00036  * generate better code by using them directly rather than
00037  * using the generic single-entry routines.
00038  */
00039 
00040 #define prefetch(a) ((void)a)
00041 
00042 struct list_head {
00043         struct list_head *next, *prev;
00044 };
00045 
00046 #define LIST_HEAD_INIT(name) { &(name), &(name) }
00047 
00048 #define INIT_LIST_HEAD(ptr) do { \
00049         (ptr)->next = (ptr); (ptr)->prev = (ptr); \
00050 } while (0)
00051 
00058 static inline void __list_add(struct list_head * new,
00059                                   struct list_head * prev,
00060                                   struct list_head * next)
00061 {
00062         next->prev = new;
00063         new->next = next;
00064         new->prev = prev;
00065         prev->next = new;
00066 }
00067 
00076 static inline void list_add(struct list_head *new,
00077                                 struct list_head *head)
00078 {
00079         __list_add(new, head, head->next);
00080 }
00081 
00090 static inline void list_add_tail(struct list_head *new,
00091                                      struct list_head *head)
00092 {
00093         __list_add(new, head->prev, head);
00094 }
00095 
00096 /*
00097  * Delete a list entry by making the prev/next entries
00098  * point to each other.
00099  *
00100  * This is only for internal list manipulation where we know
00101  * the prev/next entries already!
00102  */
00103 static inline void __list_del(struct list_head *prev,
00104                                   struct list_head *next)
00105 {
00106         next->prev = prev;
00107         prev->next = next;
00108 }
00109 
00116 static inline void list_del(struct list_head *entry)
00117 {
00118         __list_del(entry->prev, entry->next);
00119 }
00120 
00125 static inline void list_del_init(struct list_head *entry)
00126 {
00127         __list_del(entry->prev, entry->next);
00128         INIT_LIST_HEAD(entry);
00129 }
00130 
00137 static inline void list_move(struct list_head *list,
00138                                  struct list_head *head)
00139 {
00140         __list_del(list->prev, list->next);
00141         list_add(list, head);
00142 }
00143 
00150 static inline void list_move_tail(struct list_head *list,
00151                                       struct list_head *head)
00152 {
00153         __list_del(list->prev, list->next);
00154         list_add_tail(list, head);
00155 }
00156 
00161 static inline int list_empty(struct list_head *head)
00162 {
00163         return head->next == head;
00164 }
00165 
00178 static inline int list_empty_careful(const struct list_head *head)
00179 {
00180         struct list_head *next = head->next;
00181         return (next == head) && (next == head->prev);
00182 }
00183 
00184 static inline void __list_splice(struct list_head *list,
00185                                      struct list_head *head)
00186 {
00187         struct list_head *first = list->next;
00188         struct list_head *last = list->prev;
00189         struct list_head *at = head->next;
00190 
00191         first->prev = head;
00192         head->next = first;
00193 
00194         last->next = at;
00195         at->prev = last;
00196 }
00197 
00206 static inline void list_splice(struct list_head *list,
00207                                    struct list_head *head)
00208 {
00209         if (!list_empty(list))
00210                 __list_splice(list, head);
00211 }
00212 
00213 static inline void list_splice_tail(struct list_head *list, struct list_head *head)
00214 {
00215         if (!list_empty(list))
00216                 __list_splice(list, head->prev);
00217 }
00218 
00227 static inline void list_splice_init(struct list_head *list,
00228                                         struct list_head *head)
00229 {
00230         if (!list_empty(list)) {
00231                 __list_splice(list, head);
00232                 INIT_LIST_HEAD(list);
00233         }
00234 }
00235 
00242 #define list_entry(ptr, type, member) \
00243         ((type *)((char *)(ptr)-(char *)(&((type *)0)->member)))
00244 
00253 #define list_for_each(pos, head) \
00254         for (pos = (head)->next, prefetch(pos->next); pos != (head); \
00255                 pos = pos->next, prefetch(pos->next))
00256 
00266 #define list_for_each_safe(pos, n, head) \
00267         for (pos = (head)->next, n = pos->next; pos != (head); \
00268                 pos = n, n = pos->next)
00269 
00276 #define list_for_each_entry_continue(pos, head, member)                 \
00277         for (pos = list_entry(pos->member.next, typeof(*pos), member);  \
00278              prefetch(pos->member.next), &pos->member != (head);        \
00279              pos = list_entry(pos->member.next, typeof(*pos), member))
00280 
00289 struct hlist_node {
00290         struct hlist_node *next, **pprev;
00291 };
00292 
00293 struct hlist_head {
00294         struct hlist_node *first;
00295 };
00296 
00297 /* @} */
00298 
00299 /*
00300  * "NULL" might not be defined at this point
00301  */
00302 #ifdef NULL
00303 #define NULL_P NULL
00304 #else
00305 #define NULL_P ((void *)0)
00306 #endif
00307 
00313 #define HLIST_HEAD_INIT { NULL_P }
00314 #define HLIST_HEAD(name) struct hlist_head name = { NULL_P }
00315 #define INIT_HLIST_HEAD(ptr) ((ptr)->first = NULL_P)
00316 #define INIT_HLIST_NODE(ptr) ((ptr)->next = NULL_P, (ptr)->pprev = NULL_P)
00317 
00318 static inline int hlist_unhashed(const struct hlist_node *h)
00319 {
00320         return !h->pprev;
00321 }
00322 
00323 static inline int hlist_empty(const struct hlist_head *h)
00324 {
00325         return !h->first;
00326 }
00327 
00328 static inline void __hlist_del(struct hlist_node *n)
00329 {
00330         struct hlist_node *next = n->next;
00331         struct hlist_node **pprev = n->pprev;
00332         *pprev = next;
00333         if (next)
00334                 next->pprev = pprev;
00335 }
00336 
00337 static inline void hlist_del(struct hlist_node *n)
00338 {
00339         __hlist_del(n);
00340 }
00341 
00342 static inline void hlist_del_init(struct hlist_node *n)
00343 {
00344         if (n->pprev)  {
00345                 __hlist_del(n);
00346                 INIT_HLIST_NODE(n);
00347         }
00348 }
00349 
00350 static inline void hlist_add_head(struct hlist_node *n,
00351                                       struct hlist_head *h)
00352 {
00353         struct hlist_node *first = h->first;
00354         n->next = first;
00355         if (first)
00356                 first->pprev = &n->next;
00357         h->first = n;
00358         n->pprev = &h->first;
00359 }
00360 
00361 /* next must be != NULL */
00362 static inline void hlist_add_before(struct hlist_node *n,
00363                                         struct hlist_node *next)
00364 {
00365         n->pprev = next->pprev;
00366         n->next = next;
00367         next->pprev = &n->next;
00368         *(n->pprev) = n;
00369 }
00370 
00371 static inline void hlist_add_after(struct hlist_node *n,
00372                                        struct hlist_node *next)
00373 {
00374         next->next = n->next;
00375         n->next = next;
00376         next->pprev = &n->next;
00377 
00378         if(next->next)
00379                 next->next->pprev  = &next->next;
00380 }
00381 
00382 #define hlist_entry(ptr, type, member) container_of(ptr,type,member)
00383 
00384 #define hlist_for_each(pos, head) \
00385         for (pos = (head)->first; pos && (prefetch(pos->next), 1); \
00386              pos = pos->next)
00387 
00388 #define hlist_for_each_safe(pos, n, head) \
00389         for (pos = (head)->first; pos && (n = pos->next, 1); \
00390              pos = n)
00391 
00399 #define hlist_for_each_entry(tpos, pos, head, member)                    \
00400         for (pos = (head)->first;                                            \
00401              pos && ({ prefetch(pos->next); 1;}) &&                          \
00402                 ({ tpos = hlist_entry(pos, typeof(*tpos), member); 1;}); \
00403              pos = pos->next)
00404 
00411 #define hlist_for_each_entry_continue(tpos, pos, member)                 \
00412         for (pos = (pos)->next;                                              \
00413              pos && ({ prefetch(pos->next); 1;}) &&                          \
00414                 ({ tpos = hlist_entry(pos, typeof(*tpos), member); 1;}); \
00415              pos = pos->next)
00416 
00423 #define hlist_for_each_entry_from(tpos, pos, member)                     \
00424         for (; pos && ({ prefetch(pos->next); 1;}) &&                        \
00425                 ({ tpos = hlist_entry(pos, typeof(*tpos), member); 1;}); \
00426              pos = pos->next)
00427 
00436 #define hlist_for_each_entry_safe(tpos, pos, n, head, member)            \
00437         for (pos = (head)->first;                                            \
00438              pos && ({ n = pos->next; 1; }) &&                               \
00439                 ({ tpos = hlist_entry(pos, typeof(*tpos), member); 1;}); \
00440              pos = n)
00441 
00442 /* @} */
00443 
00449 #define list_for_each_prev(pos, head) \
00450         for (pos = (head)->prev, prefetch(pos->prev); pos != (head);     \
00451                 pos = pos->prev, prefetch(pos->prev))
00452 
00459 #define list_for_each_entry(pos, head, member)                          \
00460         for (pos = list_entry((head)->next, typeof(*pos), member),      \
00461                      prefetch(pos->member.next);                            \
00462              &pos->member != (head);                                        \
00463              pos = list_entry(pos->member.next, typeof(*pos), member),  \
00464              prefetch(pos->member.next))
00465 
00472 #define list_for_each_entry_reverse(pos, head, member)                  \
00473         for (pos = list_entry((head)->prev, typeof(*pos), member);      \
00474              prefetch(pos->member.prev), &pos->member != (head);            \
00475              pos = list_entry(pos->member.prev, typeof(*pos), member))
00476 
00484 #define list_for_each_entry_safe(pos, n, head, member)                   \
00485         for (pos = list_entry((head)->next, typeof(*pos), member),       \
00486                 n = list_entry(pos->member.next, typeof(*pos), member);  \
00487              &pos->member != (head);                                         \
00488              pos = n, n = list_entry(n->member.next, typeof(*n), member))
00489 
00490 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */

00492 #ifdef HAVE_HLIST_FOR_EACH_3ARG
00493 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry(tpos, pos, head, member) \
00494         hlist_for_each_entry(tpos, head, member)
00495 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_safe(tpos, pos, n, head, member) \
00496         hlist_for_each_entry_safe(tpos, n, head, member)
00497 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_continue(tpos, pos, member) \
00498         hlist_for_each_entry_continue(tpos, member)
00499 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_from(tpos, pos, member) \
00500         hlist_for_each_entry_from(tpos, member)
00501 #else
00502 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry(tpos, pos, head, member) \
00503         hlist_for_each_entry(tpos, pos, head, member)
00504 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_safe(tpos, pos, n, head, member) \
00505         hlist_for_each_entry_safe(tpos, pos, n, head, member)
00506 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_continue(tpos, pos, member) \
00507         hlist_for_each_entry_continue(tpos, pos, member)
00508 #define cfs_hlist_for_each_entry_from(tpos, pos, member) \
00509         hlist_for_each_entry_from(tpos, pos, member)
00510 #endif

00512 #ifdef HAVE_HLIST_ADD_AFTER
00513 #define hlist_add_behind(hnode, tail)   hlist_add_after(tail, hnode)
00514 #endif /* HAVE_HLIST_ADD_AFTER */
